Seriously considering cancelingÂ â€œNo Weigh Mayâ€ and trying it again in a year. Take this into consideration before giving up. Think back on the last 23 days.  Now think about the month before. How was your self talk? Did you have more negative self talk in the month you weighed yourself
column2: if things didnâ€™t go exactly as you liked? Or did you have more negative self talk this month? When you were unable to check on the outcome of your effort?  Ultimately itâ€™s about which provided you with a happier and healthier headspace
column3: because we all know how much attitude can effect the outcome of our results.  That is honestly a great point. Iâ€™ve been working A LOT on treating myself kindly
column4: so I honestly donâ€™t think there was much of a difference. I know I was a lot harder on myself without weigh ins when it came to treats. I would get upset with myself every time I ate a sweet or went out to eat with my husband. I felt guiltier when not weighing myself than when I had that little extra accountability during the week.  If it made it so you started over restricting it seems like it it through off your balance so maybe you would be better going back to weigh ins  The other option it tracking cals and still not weighing in so you can assure yourself you can afford to have that treat
column5: but thatâ€™s a whole lot of numbers and can be a slippery slope for a lot of people.  Or if you take body measurements you could check those without weighing I suppose  I do body measurements on Saturdays. I donâ€™t mind calorie counting at all. I have my BMR and TDEE calculated

You are 3/4th the way through May so your super close!  Maybe track cals for he next 2 days and if that doesnâ€™t make the negative thoughts and feels go away then you could just weigh Saturday as planned  I think Iâ€™ll do that. :) Thanks. I appreciate the help with this. Iâ€™m such a beginner at this kind of stuff. column1: nikigettingfit 160992751817 "2017-05-23 19:00:18 GMT" https://nikigettingfit.tumblr.com/post/160992751817/about-me "nikigettingfit: So
column2: I have over 500 followers now (wooo! You guys all rock!!). I figured I might as well tell y'all about me a bit. I have always been overweight. Itâ€™s always bothered me. In high school I kept my weight below 200 by skipping meals and doing marching band. Then I graduated and had my first kiddo. I broke 200 and havenâ€™t been below it since. Since I was 19 Iâ€™ve gained about 40 pounds (so thatâ€™s like almost ten years of weight gain). Part of that weight gain has been 5 pregnancies
column3: part of it has been hypothyroidism
column4: the last part is pizza and lazy. But Iâ€™m aware that there needed to be a change.  I started watching how much I ate in December 2016â€¦ and I still gained about 5 pounds
column5: so I decided to do something I knew worked. I started a Beachbody program and started using the 21 day fix meal plan and Shakeology along with my workouts.  Now 7 weeks after starting that Iâ€™m less than half a pound away from a ten pound weight loss.  Iâ€™m refusing to use my thyroid and my life as a busy mom of five as a crutch anymore. I turn 30 in July 2018. I want to lose a minimum of 60 pounds by then
column6: but Iâ€™m really pushing towards my ultimate goal of 100 pounds being gone forever. :)  TL;DR  Iâ€™m a mom of five kids under 8 years old with hypothyroid. Iâ€™m only 28 and trying to lose 60-100 pound before my 30th in 2018. So
column7: itâ€™s been a little while and I have a smidge over 2k followers now. (Y'all still rock
column8: in case you didnâ€™t get the memo.) Hereâ€™s a little blurb about me. ğŸ˜˜ Have a great day!" False text

nikigettingfit 160914215587 "2017-05-21 17:05:30 GMT" https://nikigettingfit.tumblr.com/post/160914215587/for-a-lot-people-sunday-is-viewed-as-a-day-of "For a lot people Sunday is viewed as a day of rest. That doesnâ€™t have to mean you need to sit around doing nothing for 24 hours. Sunday can be set aside for self-care. (And if Sunday isnâ€™t your day off during the week
column2: make sure you take some time off at least once a week to refill your â€œbatteriesâ€.)One thing that has become an important part of my personal self care regimen is meditation. I know it may sound hokey
column3: but it really does help. If the idea of meditation scares your or even makes you laugh
column5: meditation is a practice that can help you focus your mind on the present. Which is something that can be hard to do if you have depression and anxiety like I do.Anxiety causes me to worry about things in the future
column6: while my depression keeps me tied to things that have happened in the past. Itâ€™s an exhausting way to live. I started guided meditations last year. It feels weird at first and I did feel kind of stupid sitting in a quiet room with my eyes closed.Meditation has helped be more present in my day to day life. Iâ€™ve been able to allow my mind to see things that have happened or may happen
column7: but the thoughts (after a year of meditation) are starting to become fleeting as I live more in the present.I promise this isnâ€™t some mumbo-jumbo. Your mind can be trained just like any other part of your body. You can train your mind to focus on the good. Of course
column8: life wonâ€™t always be good. Bad things will come and go
column9: but learning to live in the present can drastically improve the way you view the world and the events of your life.If you want to give meditation a try I recommend the appÂ â€œStop
column10: Breathe & Thinkâ€. I found it for free on the app store and itâ€™s the one Iâ€™ve used. It helped me a lot when I was first starting meditation. There are a lot of other guided meditation apps and programs out there too. Iâ€™m not being paid or anything to talk about this app. I just really like it.So take 3
column13: 30 minutes today and do something that can help improve yourself. Take care of yourself. Be gentle to yourself. You are an amazing person!Â " True text
